docs.title: Developer Documentation
docs.subtitle: Discover the powerful features of Prompt Hub and master the art of AI prompt creation

getting_started.title: Getting Started
getting_started.description: Learn the basic concepts and features of Prompt Hub, and quickly start using the platform to create AI magic.

context_engineering.title: Context Engineering
context_engineering.description: The next generation AI interaction paradigm that makes AI truly understand and adapt to your needs, building personalized AI assistants.

concepts.title: Context Engineering Core Concepts
concepts.description: Deeply understand the theoretical foundations, technical architecture and design principles of context engineering, and master the core elements of the next generation AI interaction paradigm.

index.coreConceptDesc: Context Engineering is a revolutionary AI interaction methodology that builds an intelligent context adaptation system, enabling AI to dynamically adjust its response style and content based on user preferences, usage habits, historical interactions, and current situations.
index.coreConceptDesc2: Unlike traditional static prompts, Context Engineering creates a learning and adaptive AI interaction environment, making every conversation more precise, personalized, and efficient.
index.keyFeature1: Personalized Adaptation - AI learns your preferences and style
index.keyFeature2: Dynamic Adjustment - Real-time response optimization based on context
index.keyFeature3: Continuous Learning - Continuous improvement from each interaction
index.keyFeature4: Intelligent Prediction - Predicts user needs and intentions
index.exampleDesc: Imagine you have a "code review assistant". Traditional prompts give the same format of suggestions every time. With Context Engineering, it remembers that you're a Python developer, prefer concise comments, focus on performance optimization, and automatically adopts your preferred code style and focus in subsequent reviews, just like a colleague who truly understands you.

implementation.conceptsDesc: Deeply understand the theoretical foundations and technical architecture of context engineering
implementation.gettingStartedDesc: 5-minute quick start guide to context engineering
implementation.userGuideDesc: Detailed feature usage tutorials and operation guides
implementation.bestPracticesDesc: Expert experience sharing and practical tips
implementation.advancedToolsDesc: Access advanced context engineering tool center
implementation.analyticsDesc: Deep analysis and optimization suggestions for personal prompts

getting_started.title: Context Engineering Quick Start
getting_started.description: Experience the power of context engineering in 5 minutes, build your personalized AI assistant from scratch.

profile.title: Build Personal Profile
profile.description: Let AI understand your preferences and working style

adaptation.title: Experience Smart Adaptation
adaptation.description: See how AI automatically adjusts based on your usage

monitoring.title: Monitor Learning Progress
monitoring.description: View personalization effects and usage statistics in real-time

suggestions.title: Get Smart Suggestions
suggestions.description: Receive personalized improvement suggestions and tips

step1.title: Create or Select a Prompt
step1.description: Start by browsing PromptHub's public prompts, or create your first prompt
step1.action: Go to the prompt library and select a prompt of interest
tips: Start with popular "Code Assistant" or "Writing Assistant" prompts
Choose prompts related to your work area for better experience
New users are recommended to start with simple general prompts

step2.title: View "My Context"
step2.description: In the prompt detail page, find the "My Context" module to understand personalization features
step2.action: Scroll to the bottom of the prompt detail page to view the personalization panel
tips: First-time users will see a "Start Your Personalization Journey" prompt
Full personalization features are only available after logging in
Each prompt has its own independent personalization context

step3.title: Have Your First Interaction
step3.description: Use the prompt for your first AI conversation and experience the learning process of context engineering
step3.action: Click the "Try Now" button to have your first conversation with AI
tips: You can ask any question related to the prompt
The system will record your preferences and feedback
Don't worry about mistakes, every interaction is a learning opportunity

step4.title: Set Personal Preferences
step4.description: Access account settings to configure your basic preferences and help AI understand you better
step4.action: Go to Account Settings ‚Üí Personalization Preferences to set basic information
tips: Language style, professionalism level, answer length, etc. are all important
Preference settings will affect the performance of all prompts
You can modify them anytime, no need to set them perfectly at once

step5.title: View Learning Effects
step5.description: Return to the prompt page to see how AI adjusts its responses based on your usage
step5.action: Continue using the prompt and observe changes in AI responses
tips: After multiple uses, responses will become more aligned with your preferences
You can see learning progress in "My Context"
Providing feedback can accelerate personalization effects

q1.question: Do I need a technical background to use it?
q1.answer: Absolutely not! Context Engineering is designed to be user-friendly for everyone, with an intuitive interface that requires no programming knowledge.

q2.question: How long does personalization take to take effect?
q2.answer: Basic personalization takes effect immediately, while deep learning usually requires 3-5 interactions. The system continues to optimize, the more you use it, the better the results.

q3.question: Is my data safe?
q3.answer: Absolutely safe. Your personal data belongs entirely to you, and you can view, modify, or delete it at any time. We adopt strict privacy protection measures.

q4.question: Can I use multiple prompts at the same time?
q4.answer: Of course! Each prompt has its own independent personalization context, and you can use different prompts in different scenarios.

next.title: üéâ Congratulations! You've mastered the basics
next.description: You now understand the basic usage of context engineering. Continue exploring advanced features to discover more possibilities.

userGuide.title: Detailed User Guide
userGuide.description: Learn more about all features and usage tips

bestPractices.title: Best Practices
bestPractices.description: Expert experience and advanced usage tips

user_guide.title: Context Engineering User Guide
user_guide.description: Detailed feature usage tutorials to help you make the most of all context engineering features and become an AI personalization expert.

personal_context.title: Personal Context Management
personal_context.description: Learn how to view and manage your personalized AI data

viewing.title: Viewing My Context
viewing.content: At the bottom of any prompt detail page, you can find the "My Context" module. This shows how well AI understands you and the level of personalization.
tips: First-time users will see a "Start Your Personalization Journey" guide
Each prompt has its own independent context data
Context data is entirely yours
examples: Total Usage: Shows how often you use this prompt
Success Rate: Satisfaction calculated based on your feedback
Personalization Days: Time from first use to now

history.title: Interaction History Tracking
history.content: The system records every interaction with AI, including input, output, feedback, and applied personalization rules. This data helps AI better understand your needs.
tips: Switch between concise/professional view modes
Professional mode shows more technical details
History supports search and filtering
warnings: History only saves the most recent 100 interactions
Deleting history will affect personalization effectiveness

insights.title: Learning Insights Analysis
insights.content: AI analyzes your usage patterns to provide personalized improvement suggestions and usage tips. These insights help you better utilize the AI assistant.
examples: Usage Patterns: Your preferred interaction times and frequency
Preference Style: Answer styles AI has identified you like
Improvement Suggestions: Personalized suggestions based on usage data

adaptation_rules.title: Smart Adaptation Rules
adaptation_rules.description: Learn how to create and manage rules that automatically adapt AI to your needs

understanding.title: Understanding Adaptation Rules
understanding.content: Adaptation rules are intelligent systems that allow AI to automatically adjust behavior based on different situations. Rules can be triggered based on time, device, usage scenarios, and other conditions.
tips: Start with simple rules and gradually increase complexity
Rules have priorities to avoid conflicts
Regularly check rule effectiveness and adjust
examples: Time Rules: More formal during work hours, more relaxed during leisure time
Device Rules: More concise on mobile, more detailed on desktop
Scenario Rules: More technical for programming questions, more creative for writing questions

creating.title: Creating Personal Rules
creating.content: You can create personal adaptation rules for any prompt you use. These rules only affect your experience, not other users.
tips: Use visual rule builder, no programming knowledge needed
Rules can be enabled/disabled at any time
Supports A/B testing to verify rule effectiveness
warnings: Too many complex rules may cause inconsistent behavior
System chooses highest priority rule when conflicts occur

management.title: Rule Management and Optimization
management.content: Through the rule management interface, you can view all rule performance, enable or disable specific rules, and optimize based on effectiveness data.
examples: Rule List: View all activated and disabled rules
Effect Statistics: Trigger count and satisfaction for each rule
Rule Conflict Detection: Automatically identify possible rule conflicts

analytics.title: Usage Analytics Insights
analytics.description: Deep dive into your AI usage patterns and optimization opportunities

personal.title: Personal Usage Analytics
personal.content: Personal analytics page provides your complete usage profile on PromptHub, including preference analysis, usage trends, effectiveness evaluation, and more.
tips: Regularly review analytics reports to understand usage habits
Monitor satisfaction trends and adjust when issues are found
Use usage patterns to optimize workflows
examples: Usage Frequency: Daily, weekly, monthly usage statistics
Prompt Preferences: Most commonly used prompt types and domains
Effectiveness Trends: Personalization effectiveness improvement over time

prompt_specific.title: Prompt-Specific Analytics
prompt_specific.content: In-depth usage analysis for specific prompts to help you understand AI usage effectiveness in different scenarios.
examples: Interaction Patterns: Typical usage patterns on this prompt
Effectiveness Score: Objective effectiveness evaluation based on feedback
Improvement Space: Directions where personalization can still be optimized

comparative.title: Comparative Analysis
comparative.content: Compare effectiveness across different time periods, different prompts, and different rules to discover the AI usage method best suited for you.
warnings: Comparative analysis requires sufficient usage data support
Short-term fluctuations do not represent long-term trends

experiments.title: A/B Testing and Experiments
experiments.description: Scientifically test and optimize your AI interaction strategies

design.title: Personal Experiment Design
design.content: You can create A/B tests for your AI usage, comparing the effectiveness of different rules and different preference settings to find the optimal configuration.
tips: Test only one variable at a time to ensure reliable results
Set reasonable test periods, usually 1-2 weeks
Collect sufficient sample size before making decisions
examples: Rule Testing: Compare effectiveness with and without specific rules
Style Testing: Compare satisfaction with different answer styles
Length Testing: Compare preference for concise vs detailed answers

analysis.title: Experiment Result Analysis
analysis.content: The system provides detailed experiment result analysis, including statistical significance tests, confidence intervals, effect sizes, and other professional metrics.
warnings: Consider external factors' impact on experiments

optimization.title: Experiment-Based Optimization
optimization.content: Based on experiment results, the system provides personalized optimization suggestions to help you adjust rules and preference settings.
tips: Gradual optimization, avoid drastic changes
Regularly reassess to adapt to changing needs
Record optimization history for easy review

tools.title: Advanced Tool Set
tools.content: Professional users can use advanced context engineering tools, including complex rule building, batch optimization, API integration, and more.
tips: Recommended to try advanced features after some usage experience
Advanced tools require more configuration and maintenance
Make full use of preset templates to get started quickly

api.title: API Integration
api.content: Integrate context engineering features into your workflows or applications through APIs to achieve automated personalized AI experiences.
examples: Webhook: Automatically notify when personalization effectiveness reaches threshold
REST API: Programmatic access to personal context data
GraphQL: Flexible querying of personalization analytics data

export.title: Data Export/Import
export.content: You can export personal context engineering data for backup or migration, or import pre-configured rule sets.
warnings: Pay attention to compatibility with existing rules when importing
Personal data export contains sensitive information, please keep it safe

api.title: API Reference
api.description: Complete API documentation to help you integrate prompts into your own applications.

auth.title: Authentication
auth.description: All API requests require authentication. MCP Prompt Server supports the following authentication methods:
auth.apiKeyDesc: You can provide your API key in any of the following ways

performance.title: Performance Analysis API
performance.trackUsageDesc: Record prompt usage for performance analysis

errors.title: Error Handling
errors.description: API requests may return the following error codes:

reference.title: Detailed Reference
reference.authDesc: Detailed API authentication and authorization mechanism documentation

best_practices.title: Prompt Best Practices
best_practices.description: Learn how to design efficient and reliable prompts to improve the quality and consistency of AI model outputs.

advanced.title: Advanced Features
advanced.description: Dive deep into the advanced features of Prompt Hub and unlock the full potential of the platform.

mcp_integration.title: Integration with MCP Prompt Server
mcp_integration.description: Prompt Hub frontend seamlessly integrates with MCP Prompt Server backend, providing a complete prompt management solution. MCP Prompt Server supports two deployment modes: local deployment (using file storage) and remote deployment (using Supabase storage).

items.q1: What is the relationship between Prompt Hub and MCP Prompt Server?
items.a1: Prompt Hub is a modern frontend interface for MCP Prompt Server, designed to improve user experience and provide richer visual features. MCP Prompt Server handles core functionalities such as prompt storage, retrieval, and performance tracking, while Prompt Hub provides an intuitive user interface to use these features.
items.q2: How do I connect Prompt Hub to a remote MCP Prompt Server?
items.a2: You can connect to a remote server by modifying the API_URL variable in the .env.local file. Make sure to also set the correct API_KEY for authentication.
items.q3: Does Prompt Hub support multi-user collaboration?
items.a3: Yes, Prompt Hub supports user registration and authentication, allowing multiple users to collaboratively manage the prompt library. Each prompt records creator and editor information, facilitating team collaboration and version management.
